intro: Soleniscia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny leaves and showy, dandelion-like flowers. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing their adaptability to harsh environments. Soleniscia species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their unique appearance. They play a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and supporting local biodiversity.
